definition: (fig.) to get involved in an unsavory enterprise
old variant of 趟[tang1]
classifier for times, round trips or rows/a time/a trip
to wade/to trample/to turn the soil
muddy/to mix
surname Shui
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes

sentences.english: Germany doesn't want to be involved in the deadly hunt for the Taliban.
sentences.chinese: 所以，德国不想趟追杀塔利班这趟浑水。

sentences.english: Katine said he hopes the muddied waters can be cleared up by the U.S. Supreme Court soon.
sentences.chinese: 凯庭希望最高法院尽快把这趟浑水搞清楚。

sentences.english: Why should Russia go to the trouble of standing up for Serbia?
sentences.chinese: 俄罗斯为什么要趟这趟浑水支持塞尔维亚？

definition: variant of 趟渾水|趟浑水[tang1 hun2 shui3]
to mix/to mingle/to interfere/to meddle
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
stir up the fire and you get burnt (idiom); to get one's fingers burnt/fig. to suffer on account of one's own meddling
to use the current topic to put over one's own ideas/to use sth as a pretext to make a fuss
not to get involved/to stay out of it
to ask for trouble (idiom)/to make a rod for one's own back
(coll.) to cause trouble for sb/to inconvenience
to have an acrimonious falling-out/to shed all pretense of cordiality/to tear into each other
to invite a snub/to court a rebuff
internal strife (family, group, etc)
to upset the apple cart/to disrupt things
meddling in other people's business
to look for employment/to pick a quarrel
lit. to pull sb into the water/to involve sb in a messy business/to get sb into trouble
to watch the fires burning across the river/to delay entering the fray until all others have been exhausted by fighting amongst themselves (idiom)
